paper_abstract: In this paper, we study k-noncrossing, sigma-canonical RNA pseudoknot structures with minimum arc-length greater or equal to four. Let t(k,sigma)([4])(n) denote the number of these structures. We derive exact enumeration results by computing the generating function T(k,sigma)([4])(z) = Sigma(n) T(k,sigma)([4])(n)z(n) and derive the asymptotic formulas T(k,3)([4])(n) similar to c(k) n-((k-1)2-k-1/2)(gamma([4])(k,3))(-n) for k = 3,...,9. In particular, we have for k = 3, T(3,3)([4])(n) similar to c(3) n(-5) 2.0348(n). Our results show that the set of biophysically relevant RNA pseudoknot structures is surprisingly small and suggest a new structure class as target for prediction algorithms.
